1.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, He not coming in through the door into the court-yard of the sheep, but coming up from another place, he is a thief and robber.

2.text: And he coming in through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.text: To him the guard of the door opens; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.

4.text: And when he would put forth his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

5.text: And a stranger they would not follow, but they will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

6.text: This proverb spake Jesus to then: and they knew not what things they were which he spake to them.

7.text: Then said Jesus again to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, That I am the door of the sheep.

8.text: All who came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep heard them not.

9.text: I am the door: if any come in through me, he shall be saved, and he shall me in, and go out, and find pasture.

10.text: The thief comes not, except that he steal, and sacrifice, and destroy: I came that they might have life, and have above measure.

11.text: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.

12.text: But the hired one, and not being the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, sees the wolf coming, and he leaves the sheep, and flees: and the wolf plunders them, and scatters the sheep.

13.text: The hired flees, because he is hired, and no care is to him for the sheep.

14.text: I am the good shepherd, and I know mine, and am known by mine.

15.text: As the Father knows me, I also know the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

16.text: And I have, other sheep, which are not of this court-yard: and I must also bring them, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one flock, and one shepherd.

17.text: Therefore does my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

18.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This command received I of my Father.

19.text: Then was a division again among the Jews for these words.

20.text: And many of them said, He has a demon, and is frenzied; why hear ye him?

21.text: Others said, These are not the words of a demon. A demon cannot open the eyes of the blind.

22.text: And there was the festival of inauguration among the Jerusalemites, and it was winter.

23.text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.

24.text: Then the Jews surrounded him, and said to him, How long takest thou away our soul? If thou art Christ, say to us with freedom of speech.

25.text: Jesus answered them, I said to you, and ye believe not: the works which I do in my Father’s name, these testify of me.

26.text: But ye believe not, for ye are not of my sheep, as I said to you.

27.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

28.text: And I give them eternal life; and they shall never perish, and no one shall snatch them out of my hand.

29.text: My Father, who has given to me, is greater than all; and no one can snatch them out of my Father’s hand.

30.text: I and my Father are one.

31.text: Then again lifted up the Jews stones that they might stone him.

32.text: Jesus Answered them, Many good works I shewed you from my Father; for which of these works do ye stone me.

33.text: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and that thou, being man, makest thyself God.

34.text: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said; Ye are gods?

35.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the writing cannot be loosed;

36.text: Whom the Father consecrated, and sent into the world, say ye that thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God.

37.text: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

38.text: And if I do, though ye believe me not, believe the works: that ye might know, and believe, that the Father in me, and I in him.

39.text: Then sought they again to take him: and he went out from their hand,

40.text: And again he departed beyond Jordan to the place where John was first immersing; and he remained there.

41.text: And many came to him, and said, That truly John did no sign: but all which John said of him was true.

42.text: And many believed in him there.
